title.value: Public Perspectives on Exposure Notification Apps: A Patient and Citizen Co-Designed Study
title.justification: The title is explicitly mentioned at the beginning of the document.
title.quote: Public Perspectives on Exposure Notification Apps: A Patient and Citizen Co-Designed Study

extractions.description: The study assesses public use, knowledge, and concerns regarding the COVID Alert app in Québec, Canada. It identifies predictors for app downloads and strategies for promoting social acceptability, emphasizing public involvement in the design process.

type.justification: The paper involves survey data collection, analysis, and interpretation to understand public perspectives, which aligns with empirical research.
type.quote: A 36-item questionnaire was co-designed by 12 citizens and patients partnered with 16 academic researchers and was distributed in the province of Québec, Canada, from May 27 to 28 June 2021.

name.justification: The paper focuses on the use and public acceptance of digital exposure notification apps in a public health context.
name.quote: Canada deployed a digital exposure notification app (COVID Alert) as a strategy to support manual contact tracing.

name.justification: The study involves the use of informatics tools (apps) for health-related data collection and contact tracing.
name.quote: Canada deployed a digital exposure notification app (COVID Alert) as a strategy to support manual contact tracing.

name.justification: The research considers public perceptions, concerns, and influences on behavior related to app adoption.
name.quote: Our aims are to (1) assess the use, knowledge, and concerns of the COVID Alert app, (2) identify predictors of app downloads, and (3) develop strategies to promote social acceptability.
